As a change of pace from pizza for a Super Bowl party, consider a Spanish tortilla. It's nothing like the Mexican flatbread of the same name, but is closely related to an Italian frittata, a thick round omelet layered with potatoes and onions. In Spain it is a tapas bar staple, served either warmed or at room temperature.

Though a good tortilla is not difficult to prepare, to simplify feeding a crowd there are now frozen ones. The El Forno brand from Spain, which is sold at Agata & Valentina, comes in a nine-inch size that will serve six to eight ($10.99), and with spinach or peppers in a seven-inch size to serve four ($9.99). The tortillas take 10 minutes to heat in a microwave or conventional oven or in a skillet with a cover. Sangria anyone?
